intro: Stillingia dichotoma, commonly known as the twin-stemmed stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Stillingia dichotoma is also known for its medicinal properties, having been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
